intro: Teucrium alyssifolium, commonly known as lesser woundwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its small, pale blue to violet flowers bloom in whorled clusters during the summer months. Teucrium alyssifolium is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, and it has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported healing properties.
